thread.title: Pico out as Reds pitching coach as Price's 2016 staff named
thread.title_full: Pico out as Reds pitching coach as Price's 2016 staff named

title: Pico out as Reds pitching coach as Price's 2016 staff named
text:
Pico out as Reds pitching coach as Price's 2016 staff named 
Updated: Thu, Oct 22 2015, 10:31 AM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC) -- Jeff Pico will not be returning as Reds pitching coach as team President of Baseball Operations and General Manager Walt Jocketty on Thursday announced the team's 2016 coaching staff under manager Bryan Price. 
Mark Riggins will replace Pico. Riggins spent the last four seasons as the Reds minor league pitching coordinator, and previously served as pitching coach on the Major League staffs of the Chicago Cubs (2011) and St. Louis Cardinals (1995). The 2011 Cubs staff ranked 14th of 16 National League teams in ERA at 4.33, while the 1995 Cardinals staff ranked sixth of 14 National League teams with a 4.09 ERA. Riggins served as a minor league pitching coordinator from 1996-2010. 
Pico served as Reds pitching coach in 2014 and 2015, which were Price's first two seasons as manager. The 2014 pitching staff ranked ninth of 15 NL teams with an ERA of 3.59, while the 2015 staff ranked 12 of 15 NL teams with an ERA of 4.33. The 2015 team had rookie pitchers make 110 starts, including the final 64 games of the season. 
In addition to Pico being out, so too are bengh coach Jay Bell and assistant hitting coach Lee Tinsley. 
Bullpen/assistant pitching coach Mack Jenkins, hitting coach Don Long, Major League catching coordinator Mike Stefanski and bullpen catcher Dustin Hughes will return in 2016 to those positions.The following coaches will return with new responsibilities: Jim Riggleman will serve as bench coach; Billy Hatcher will coach third base and outfielders and Freddie Benavides will coach first base and infielders. Last season, Riggleman was third base coach, Hatcher first base coach and Benavides infield coach.In addition to Riggins, also new to the 2016 staff will be Tony Jaramillo as assistant hitting coach. Jaramillo has been a hitting coach in the Reds' minor league system since 2008, including each of the last three seasons at Class AAA Louisville."We appreciate the hard work and dedication Jay, Jeff and Lee gave us the last two years," Jocketty said in a release. 
Photo: AP Photo/Aaron Doster
